boat.name: Periwinkle
boat.full_description:
Periwinkle's design was based on an early 19th century fishing boat from the Itchen Ferry yards on the Hamble. She was rigged as a gaff cutter with a pole masted topsail. Her sail area amounts to 353 sq.ft which is comprised of a main of 161, jib 82, staysail 70 and topsail of 40 sq.ft..   In light winds this can be increased considerably with a racing jib of 133 and staysail of 100 sq.ft. so she can put up 434 sq. ft.

'Periwinkle' was built by Glyn White of Fowey, with a finish quite different to the North Cornwall Marine boats, 'Periwinkle'  being built to quite a distinctive spec. and finished with teak throughout the cabin.  Additional high spec finishes are apparent from the use of the very solid bird's beak jointing of the iroko capping rails and rudder.   White was a former cabinet maker who built a number of Tamarisks at his yard in Fowey. One of his former workers recognised 'Periwinkle' whilst recently moored in Fowey and told her owner about her origins and the small yard beside the water where she was built.  The yard is no longer being now replaced by houses.

She appears to have spent most of her time in the River Dart area being moored latterly in Dartmouth and is thought to have just been used for cruising along the South West coasts.  But her full sailing history is not known.
boat.short_description: 'Periwinkle' is a Tamarisk 24 designed by David Cannel and built by Glyn White of Fowey in 1983. Glyn was a former cabinet maker and thus not surprisingly she was finished to a high standard. The hull was made in GRP and the deck in marine ply, the rest in teak and iroko.
